intro: Casearia commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's casearia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
